flawed_nl_solution:
If one third (1/3) of his picks are blue, then 3 times the total number of blue picks equals his total pick count, or 3*12=36 picks
If half of the picks are red, then he has 36/2=<<36/2=18>>18 red picks
If the rest of the picks are yellow, then he has 36-18-12=<<36-18-12=1>>1 yellow picks
#### 1

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 6, not 1. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
